title: The Ant Colony
synopsis: Daily life in an ant colony that runs exactly like a tiny human city — commutes, office jobs, traffic jams, and all the mundane chaos that comes with it.
visual_style: 1920s vintage cartoon style with worn, faded muted colors and simple confident ink lines. Extremely minimal detail — sparse backgrounds, very few elements per scene, lots of empty space. Characters are simple but expressive with rubberhose-era energy. Grainy paper texture, aged and sun-bleached look. Nothing modern, nothing polished, nothing childish. Single full-bleed image, no frames, no borders, and no panel structure.

locations.name: Main Tunnel
locations.description: A busy underground corridor packed with ants commuting in both directions. Tiny street signs, overhead lighting, and a coffee stand carved into the wall.

locations.name: The Office
locations.description: A cramped dirt-walled cubicle farm deep in the colony where ants tap away at crumb-sized desks. A water cooler drips in the corner.

locations.name: The Surface
locations.description: The chaotic world above ground — towering blades of grass, enormous shoes stomping past, and a picnic blanket that might as well be a shopping mall.

characters.name: Andy
characters.description: A lanky worker ant with a backwards cap, slouchy posture, and a permanent smirk. Six legs, antennae slightly bent, and an oversized head with big expressive eyes. Looks like he'd rather be anywhere else but somehow ends up in the middle of everything.

rules: The ant colony mirrors human society — jobs, commutes, social events, bureaucracy — but everything is ant-sized and made of dirt, crumbs, and leaves.
Andy is lazy, sarcastic, and a bit of a troublemaker, but never mean.
Situations should parody real human life — office drama, rush hour, bad dates, grocery shopping — but through the lens of ant life.
Keep the tone loose, funny, and absurd. Nothing serious ever happens.
long_term_narrative: Andy navigates the absurdity of everyday ant-colony life while doing as little actual work as possible.
Small situations snowball into ridiculous messes through Andy's involvement.
narrative_premise: Andy navigates the absurdity of everyday ant-colony life with maximum sarcasm and minimum effort, turning small situations into ridiculous messes.
